instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only runs on battery
threads.message: got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> runs on the battery but is pulsing on <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with power supply only no battery connected. I have already tried swapping out the smc with the same results. system fan flickers as the voltage goes from 0-2-3v and cycles over. battery connected and it turns right on. 85W power supply.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only runs on battery
threads.message: Check sense resistors, resistance on pins 17/18 and 27/28........ Only charger of course..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only runs on battery
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only runs on battery
threads.message: Destroyed by Chinese garbage charger, make sure to never use it again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only runs on battery
threads.message: Thanks for letting me know duke, this was sent in by a customer in Sweden so i will make sure to let him know.  In fact everything on the board was fried,  wifi and ssd and keyboard also. He did not send it in with the battery, do you think the battery could be bad as well now?
